newsitem.title: CANADA: DBRS confirms Investors Group debt.
newsitem.headline: DBRS confirms Investors Group debt.

text.p: Dominion Bond Rating Service said on Tuesday it confirmed the rating on Investors Group Inc's deposits and senior debt at A (high), with a stable trend.
DBRS said IGI has performed favourably through the first nine months of 1996, with strong earnings momentum expected to continue through the full year.
The bond rating service said IGI generally performs well in flat markets and exceptionally well when markets are rising, as the fee income increases with the expanded mutual fund base.

Core earnings increased 18 percent to C$85.4 million over the prior year, resulting in a return on equity of 18.5 percent, which is strong when considering the large capital base, DBRS said. It said the common equity to total assets ratio is conservative at 34 percent.
DBRS said concerns include increased future competition and the potential for narrowing profit margins as the industry continues to mature.
